title: The {U}niversity of {H}elsinki Submissions to the {WMT}19 Similar Language Translation Task
authors:
Scherrer, Yves  and
V{\'a}zquez, Ra{\'u}l  and
Virpioja, Sami
venue: Proceedings of the Fourth Conference on Machine Translation (Volume 3: Shared Task Papers, Day 2)
abstract: This paper describes the University of Helsinki Language Technology groupâ€™s participation in the WMT 2019 similar language translation task. We trained neural machine translation models for the language pairs Czech <-> Polish and Spanish <-> Portuguese. Our experiments focused on different subword segmentation methods, and in particular on the comparison of a cognate-aware segmentation method, Cognate Morfessor, with character segmentation and unsupervised segmentation methods for which the data from different languages were simply concatenated. We did not observe major benefits from cognate-aware segmentation methods, but further research may be needed to explore larger parts of the parameter space. Character-level models proved to be competitive for translation between Spanish and Portuguese, but they are slower in training and decoding.
